io.github.utk003.util.data.collection.slice

Class SliceIndexOutOfBoundsException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
            • java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
              • io.github.utk003.util.data.collection.slice.SliceIndexOutOfBoundsException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class SliceIndexOutOfBoundsException
extends ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
    An exception that is thrown to indicate that a Slice has been accessed with an illegal index.

    If this exception is thrown, the index provided is either negative, greater than or equal to the size of the array, or results in the creation of a slice with negative length.

    Since:
    2.1.0
    Version:
    June 11, 2021
    Author:
    Utkarsh Priyam (utk003)
    See Also:
    Slice, Slice.length(), Serialized Form
